content:
Is there a way to transfer a lean3 project into lean4?
Or do I need to manually re-write the whole thing?
Mathport can automate a lot of the transfer, although it usually needs some manual fixing afterwards https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathport

how long would it take approximately for mathport to run?
and, realistically, how much fixing would probably be needed?
Not long at all, and it depends on how big and complex your project is. It translated the whole of mathlib but it needed a bunch of human assistance. But parts of mathlib were very complex.
It takes me two hours to set mathport up every time I need it. The translation is pretty much instantaneous afterwards.

Well, the sentence "the translation is pretty much instantaneous afterwards" is optimistic in my experience. I have been porting a project for a week now and I am certainly not done. But it is way faster than rewriting the whole thing, for sure!
Oh I don't mean the subsequent fixing! I mean the step of "running mathport", which indeed takes a minute or so.

Yaël Dillies said:

Oh I don't mean the subsequent fixing! I mean the step of "running mathport", which indeed takes a minute or so.

Mine took about 15 minutes. But that's still pretty quick compared to how long I thought it would take!
Monica Omar has marked this topic as resolved.
